metadata.title: CVE-2015-1805 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The (1) pipe_read and (2) pipe_write implementations in fs/pipe.c in theLinux kernel before 3.16 do not properly consider the side effects offailed __copy_to_user_inatomic and __copy_from_user_inatomic calls, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possiblygain privileges via a crafted application, aka an "I/O vector arrayoverrun."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
